meanings.definition: Of or relating to the minimum strength of an electric current that will produce a response in a nerve or muscle fiber.
meanings.sent1: The rheobasic current was just enough to make the muscle twitch.
meanings.sent2: The scientist adjusted the rheobasic settings to stimulate the nerve.
meanings.sent3: The rheobasic level of electricity made the muscle dance like a puppet.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the rheobasic force that kept her going against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The rheobasic intensity of the current was like a gentle tap on the nerve.
